name: Space Needle
hint1: It had the same designer as the nation's first shopping mall.
hint2: Built for the 1962 World's Fair
hint3: Iconic landmark in Lower Queen Anne

name: The Gum Wall
hint1: A sticky situation.
hint2: Tourists add their own contributions, after chewing them.
hint3: Kinda gross attraction at Pike Place Market
solutionDescription: The Gum Wall at Pike Place Market

name: Wayward Vegan Caf√©
hint1: Southern cooking for "LOST" vegans.
hint2: It's in the Ravenna neighborhood of Seattle.
hint3: Distant Worlds Coffee Shop is just down the street and had to change it's name to stop being confused with this establishment.
solutionLocation: 801 NE 65th St Suite C, Seattle, WA 98115

name: Vegan Pizza Pi
hint1: You = hungry for vegan ‚í´iz2Œ±.
hint2: It's in the University District of Seattle.
hint3: Location hint: FDR was not the 53rd president.
solutionDescription: Far out! üçï Show this page to your server for 15% off any salad or dessert!

name: El Borracho (Ballard)
hint1: This plant-based Mexican restaurant can make you the drunk, too.
hint2: Mexican food in the Swedish district??
hint3: You've walked right by it if you've been to the Ballard Sunday Market!
solutionDescription: Congratulations! üéâ Show this page to your server to get a free vegan queso!

name: Seattle Great Wheel
hint1: There are great views from this revolving attraction.
hint2: An iconic part of the Seattle skyline since 2012
hint3: Maybe get some fish at Ivar's while you're nearby.

name: Smith Tower
hint1: This was once the tallest building West of the Mississippi
hint2: There's a great bar at the top.
hint3: The observation deck has great views of Elliott Bay and Pioneer Square
solutionLocation: Smith Tower, at the ticket kiosk

name: Jimi Hendrix Statue
hint1: One of the greatest American musicians, remembered.
hint2: A guitar legend of the 60s.
hint3: Excuse me while I kiss the sky.
solutionLocation: On the corner of Broadway and Pine

name: Clock Tower
hint1: The Great Northern Railroad depot was finished in 1902
hint2: An iconic landmark for the 1974 World's Fair
hint3: Was the only remaining building on Havermale Island after it was remodled
solutionLocation: The Spokane Clock Tower at Riverfront Park

name: Fox Theater
hint1: This iconic Art Deco building was opened in 1931.
hint2: After a recent renovation, the building is the home of the Spokane Symphony.
hint3: It was part of the Fox Film Corporation Empire founded by studio mogul William Fox
solutionDescription: The Martin Woldson Theater at the FOX

name: St Johns Cathedral
hint1: This building is built entirely of cut stone with the carvings and figures in stained glass.
hint2: The organ was built and installed in 1957 with 4,039 pipes.
hint3: It rises prominently on the crest of a hill making it visable from much of downtown and areas to the north

name: Steam Plant Brew Pub
hint1: This building was originaly purposed to heat and supply power to homes and businesses
hint2: The twin iconic strucures tower 225 feet
hint3: In the summer of 1996 it was transformed into a gastro pub
solutionDescription: You did it! üéâ Show this page to your server to get 15% off your next meal!

name: Clinkerdagger
hint1: 40 year old steak house.
hint2: A Spokane landmark that overlooks the Spokane River and city skyline.
hint3: That's one sharp sounding name!
solutionLocation: The Flour Mill 621 W. Mallon Ave.
solutionDescription: Congratulations! Show this page to your server to get 10% off any appetizer!

name: Pavilion
hint1: This structure was a gift to Spokane from the United Stated government.
hint2: It's initial purpose was to house exibits that focused on enviornmental issues.
hint3: Richard Nixon delared that Expo '74 was officially open to all the citizens of the world at the base of this structure.

name: Garland Milk Bottle
hint1: The lactose intollerant need not apply.
hint2: This place was built in 1935 and designed to build better men and women by making milk more attractive to boys and girls.
hint3: Notable for it's bottle architecture.
solutionDescription: You cheesed it! Show this page to your server for a free glass of milk! What fun.

name: Arbor Crest Wine Cellars
hint1: This building has one heck of a view.
hint2: Overlooking the Spokane Valley it sits alone on a ridge.
hint3: Probably want to watch your step, especially with all this alcohol around.

name: Bowl and Pitcher
hint1: You really need a lot of imagination to see these two things.
hint2: While you're there you might as well check out the famous rope bridge.
hint3: If you see a dead body just leave it for the wolves.
solutionDescription: The Bowl and Pitcher at Riverside State Park

name: Taco Bell
hint1: Feels like a sweatpants kind of night.
hint2: Your one stop shop for grilled stuffed burritos. And sadness.
hint3: Go to the one on 3rd, next to the Carlise Hotel. Dinner and a show.
solutionDescription: Congratulations! You have diarrhea. Is it a coincidence that you're also at Taco Bell?

name: Campbell House
hint1: This is a historic house museum.
hint2: The Northwest Museum of Arts and Culture is nearby.
hint3: The owner was in the mining business with the Rockefeller and Gould families.

name: Manito Park
hint1: A 90 acre park with an arboretum and conservatory.
hint2: This was at one time a zoo until 1932 when it was closed due to the Great Depression.
hint3: The lilac garden has over 100 cultivars represented. Spokane is known as the Lilac City.
solutionLocation: 1702 S Gran Blvd at the conservatory front desk
name: Kerry Park
hint1: Royal view of Seattle
hint2: Mountains and Monuments
hint3: You might see this view on a postcard
solutionLocation: Kerry Park on the top of Queen Anne

name: Bruce Lee's Gravesite
hint1: The first Asian-American actor to ever have a lead role in a Hollywood film
hint2: Be like water
hint3: Credited by many as the most influential martial artist of all time
solutionLocation: Bruce Lee's Gravesite, Lake View Cemetery

name: Amazon Spheres
hint1: Part of the headquarters of a major tech company
hint2: Houses over 40,000 plants
hint3: Three glass domes covered in pentagonal hexecontahedron panels

name: Volunteer Park Conservatory
hint1: Modeled on London's Crystal Palace
hint2: Made up of 3,426 glass panes fit into a wood and iron framework
hint3: Showcasing 5 distinct plant families, this greenhouse sits on the lush lawns of a park on a hill
solutionLocation: Volunteer Park Conservatory, Volunteer Park, Capitol Hill

name: The Walrus & the Carpenter
hint1: /The time has come,/ the ---- said, /To talk of many things, Of shoes and ships and sealing wax- Of cabbages- and kings...
hint2: One of many Sea Creatures...
hint3: Named after characters in Alice and Wonderland, this space marries restaurant to fishing pub in a delightfully delicious manner
solutionLocation: The Walrus & the Carpenter, Old Ballard

name: Deep Dive
hint1: Eat and drink inside of a Curtis Steiner art installation
hint2: A new classic, inspired by marquee hotel bars the world over
hint3: Smart attire encouraged, this upscale bar isn't found in your typical brick building...
solutionLocation: Deep Dive, Amazon Spheres, Lenora Street

name: Bathtub Gin & Co
hint1: You will have to venture down an alley to find this cozy speakeasy
hint2: Nestled in the basement of an old brick hotel, in a former broiler room in the back of a building...
hint3: Get squeaky clean in this prohibition style spot
solutionLocation: Bathtub Gin & Co, Belltown, between 1st & 2nd, 50 ft north of Blanchard, look for the wooden door...

name: Mizuna
hint1: Award winning resturaunt that's been open downtown since 1996.
hint2: The kitchen is run by a James Beard award winning chef.
hint3: The name may sound funny but that's the chef's last name.

name: Wooden City
hint1: This restaurant has locations in Tacoma and Spokane.
hint2: The name seems a little stiff.
hint3: Wood you like to order their pizza?

name: Nado Ramen House
hint1: No time to noodle around.
hint2: This establishment has stunning graphic art inside the dinning room.
hint3: Make sure you don't overlook their extensive sake menu.

name: Wild Sage Bistro
hint1: That's one crazy green-gray.
hint2: This corner bistro has big frame windows for you to look out of while you sip your wine.
hint3: Opened since 2006 it's become an award-winning local favorite.

name: Beserk
hint1: Not only is this a crazy name for a bar its also the title of a Japanese manga series.
hint2: This is out of control.
hint3: Even though the name would tell you otherwise don't break anything.

name: Mootsy's
hint1: Spokane's quinessential rock dive.
hint2: Live band venue that always has a party atmosphere.
hint3: Sounds like a pet name for Bootsy Collins.

name: Volstead Act
hint1: This place feels like the Prohibition with its decor.
hint2: It's named after a US law passed in 1919.
hint3: Located in the heart of the Davenport District.

name: Stormin Normans Shipfaced Saloon
hint1: Named after a general famous from Desert Storm.
hint2: There's also a ship in the title.
hint3: Could possibly sound like a dirty name.
